intro: Paullinia hooibrenkii, commonly known as the Hooibrenk's sarsaparilla, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. Paullinia hooibrenkii is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
